unnormalised: Mumbai: Planning a trip to Goa? Budgeting just got a tad trickier. Sources say the Goa govt. is likely to hike the tourist tax by 10%, potentially adding ₹500-₹1000 to your expenses, depending on your stay. Seems like that extra Kingfisher beer might cost a bit more now.
normalised: Mumbai: Planning a trip to Goa? Budgeting just got a tad trickier. Sources say the Goa government is likely to hike the tourist tax by ten percent, potentially adding rupee five hundred to rupee one thousand to your expenses, depending on your stay. Seems like that extra Kingfisher beer might cost a bit more now.

unnormalised: The increase, reportedly aimed at improving infrastructure, will affect everything from hotel stays (Rs. 3000/night upwards) to water sports (₹800 per activity). Expect to shell out more at shacks too - that plate of fish fry which used to cost ₹250 could now be pricier. Even the auto-rickshaw rides, usually around Rs. 150-200, might see a surge.
normalised: The increase, reportedly aimed at improving infrastructure, will affect everything from hotel stays (rupees three thousand per night upwards) to water sports (rupee eight hundred per activity). Expect to shell out more at shacks too - that plate of fish fry which used to cost rupee two hundred and fifty could now be pricier. Even the auto-rickshaw rides, usually around rupees one hundred and fifty to two hundred, might see a surge.

unnormalised: Industry experts are worried. "Goa's already competing with international destinations," said Mr. Sharma, a travel agent. "A steep hike could deter budget travelers. We're hoping they reconsider or at least phase it in gradually." So, keep an eye out for updates before booking your trip - that "sasta" Goa plan might need a rethink!
